tit.cmt: 次の文にもあるように正しくは「さだゆき」です。

sen.j: 伏見宮貞敬親王（ふしみのみや さだゆきしんのう、安永 (元号)4年12月10日 (旧暦)（1776年1月1日） - 天保12年1月21日 (旧暦)（1841年2月12日））は、江戸時代の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki (January 1, 1776 - February 12, 1841) was an Imperial family member in Edo Period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki (January 1, 1776 - February 12, 1841) was a member of the Imperial family in the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: In Edo Period -> in the Edo Period
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki (January 1, 1776 - February 12, 1841) was a member of the Imperial family in the Edo Period.
He was the 19th prince of Fushimi no miya.
He was the 19th head of the Fushiminomiya family.
sen.cmt: 「第19代伏見宮家当主」と解釈し、英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He was the 19th head of the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 伏見宮邦頼親王の王子。
sen.e: He was a son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniyori.
He was a son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniyori.
He was a son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniyori.

sen.j: 幼称は嘉禰宮（かねのみや）。
sen.e: His childfood name was Kanenomiya.
His childhood name was Kane no miya.
sen.cmt: childfood -> childhood幼称の表記を変更しました。
sen.e: His childhood name was Kane no miya.

sen.j: 天皇候補に名が挙がったことがある。
sen.e: He was once a candidate for Emperor.
He was once nominated for an heir to the Imperial throne.
sen.cmt: 邦家親王のファイルと表記を合わせました。
sen.e: He was once nominated for an heir to the Imperial throne.
In August, 1797, he was given the title of Imperial Prince.
In September 1797, he was given the title of Imperial Prince.
In September 1797, he was given the title of Imperial Prince.
He was named Sadayuki.
He was named Sadayuki.
He was named Sadayuki.

sen.j: 同月元服し、上野国太守に補任され三品に叙せられる。
sen.e: In the same month, his coming of age ceremony was celebrated, he was appointed governor of Kozuke Province and granted Sanbon (the third rank of Imperial Prince).
In the same month, as his coming of age ceremony was held, he was appointed to the governor of Kozuke Province and granted Sanbon (the third rank of Imperial Prince).
In the same month, as his coming of age ceremony was held, he was appointed to the governor of Kozuke Province and granted Sanbon (the third rank of Imperial Prince).

sen.j: 享和2年（1802年）父邦頼親王が薨去したことにより伏見宮を相続する。
sen.e: In 1802, when his father, Imperial Prince Kuniyori passed away, he succeeded to Fushimi no miya.
In 1802, when his father, Imperial Prince Kuniyori, passed away, he succeeded to the Fushiminomiya family.
sen.cmt: 表記を邦頼親王のファイルと合わせました。
sen.e: In 1802, when his father, Imperial Prince Kuniyori, passed away, he succeeded to the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)元年（1804年）兵部省となり、翌文化2年（1805年）には二品に昇叙される。
sen.e: In 1804 he became Hyobusho (ministry of military), and in 1805 he was promoted to Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince),
In 1804 he became Hyobusho (ministry of military), and in 1805 he was promoted to Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince).
sen.cmt: , （文章の終わりにカンマ）->. （ピリオドに変更しました）
sen.e: In 1804 he became Hyobusho (ministry of military), and in 1805 he was promoted to Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince).

sen.j: 文化8年（1811年）一条輝良の女輝子（てるこ）と結婚する。
sen.e: In 1811, he married Teruko ICHIJO, a daughter of Teruyoshi ICHIJO.
In 1811, he married Teruko ICHIJO, a daughter of Teruyoshi ICHIJO.
In 1811, he married Teruko ICHIJO, a daughter of Teruyoshi ICHIJO.

sen.j: 天保12年（1841年）正月一品に昇叙するが、間もなく薨去した。
sen.e: In January, 1841, soon after he was promoted to Ippon (the first rank of Imperial Prince), he passed away.
In January, 1841, soon after he was promoted to Ippon (the first rank of Imperial Prince), he passed away.
In January, 1841, soon after he was promoted to Ippon (the first rank of Imperial Prince), he passed away.
He died at the age of 67.
Died at the age of 67.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Died at the age of 67.

sen.j: 貞敬親王は子宝に恵まれ、第一王子で伏見宮を継いだ伏見宮邦家親王を始め梨本宮守脩親王ら多くの王子女を儲けた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sadayuki had many children including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, who was his first son and heir to Fushimi no miya, and Imperial Prince Nashimotonomiya Moriosa, and he was also considered a powerful figure to have sparked prosperity of Fushimi no miya along with Imperial Prince Kuniie, who had many children as well.

Imperial Prince Sadayuki had many children including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, who was his first son and the heir to the Fushiminomiya family, and Imperial Prince Nashimotonomiya Moriosa and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sadayuki had many children including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, who was his first son and the heir to the Fushiminomiya family, and Imperial Prince Nashimotonomiya Moriosa and others.

sen.j: 同様に子福者であった邦家親王とともに伏見宮隆盛のきっかけを作った人と目されている。
sen.e: Along with Imperial Prince Kuniie who also had many children, Sadayuki is regarded as the person who led the prosperity of the Fushiminomiya family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Along with Imperial Prince Kuniie who also had many children, Sadayuki is regarded as the person who led the prosperity of the Fushiminomiya family.
